intro: Diplotaxis ruscinonensis, commonly known as the Ruscinonensis diamondhead, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many well-known cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, giving the plant a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
